description: Through regular rehearsal and coaching sessions, new or already-formed chamber groups prepare and
perform selected literature, and learn about related repertoire while cultivating observation,
communication, and leadership skills.  Typical ensembles would include instrumentalists and/or
vocalists, with three to eight performers, one on a part.  Examples are string quarters, brass or
woodwind quintets, piano trios, saxophone quartets, and jazz combos.  May be repeated.  Offered
each semester.  Prerequisite: permission of instructor.
